fields.description:
{html}

[A similar ticket, 388, was just set to 'invalid' because of changes over time. However, none of these issues below have been addressed. I revalidated these issues today. The attached screenshot shows several of these issues.]

The appcelerator.com site doesn't give any indication of exactly what one receives when clicking the "DOWNLOAD TITANIUM" link. The result page also has no version or file info. The dmg file has no version info in its filename, and upon mounting and opening, there's no readme file or other way I could see to determine exactly what I have downloaded. The only option seems to be to install the program.

Somewhere (preferably before starting the download, and at every step along the way) this info should be displayed.

A further cause for confusion is that the mounted-dmg-icon that appears on the desktop is the same as the actual Titanium app, not the standard "mounted drive". (See screenshot).

{html}
fields.summary: Version Info needed in the DMG, website, and download process

comments.body:
{html}

Not an issue for the mobile team. This is an issue for our web developers and packagers.

Ralf, can you pass this on to them and invalidate this ticket?

{html}
SDK distribution now handled exclusively through Titanium Studio (and CI builds, and CLI). Gives some indication of what is being installed.
